intro: Lotus macraei, commonly known as the giant lotus, is a striking aquatic plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that float on the water's surface, providing habitat for various aquatic organisms. Its roots are submerged, anchoring the plant in shallow water bodies. Lotus macraei plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by supporting biodiversity and improving water quality.
